"There seems to be a mistake in the code snippet you've provided. The variable `i` is not defined within the context of the code. Assuming you meant to use `r` instead of `i`, the corrected loop invariant for the inner while loop (which I'll refer to as `z` loop) would be:

"min_value = min(arr[z]->arr[r])"

However, this invariant does not hold for the outer loop (`r` loop) as a whole because the inner loop (`z` loop) modifies the array. Instead, after each full iteration of the outer loop, the invariant would be:

"arr is sorted up to index r-1"

But since you've asked for the format 'xxx_value = fun(arr[xxx]->arr[xxx])', the closest we can get to that format for the outer loop invariant would be:

"min_value = min(arr[0]->arr[r-1])"

This states that the minimum value in the unsorted portion of the array is correctly placed at the beginning of that unsorted portion after each iteration of the outer loop."
